intro: Tiglium klotzschianum, commonly known as the Klotzsch's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a rough texture and prominent veins. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Tiglium klotzschianum is native to Central Asia and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
